SPScript Docs
Class: Web

Web

new Web(dao)

Represents a SharePoint site. You shouldn't ever be new'ing this class up up yourself, instead you'll get it from your dao as shown in first example.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
dao IBaseDao Data access object used to make requests.
Properties:
Name Type Description
permissions Permissions allows checking security information of the Web
baseUrl string API relative url (value = "/web")
Source:
  • web.js, line 16
Example

You access this Web class using the 'web' property of the dao

var dao = new SPScript.RestDao(_spPageContextInfo.webAbsoluteUrl);
dao.web.info().then(function(info) { console.log(info) });

Methods

copyFile(sourceUrl, destinationUrl, [requestDigest]opt)

Copies a file
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
sourceUrl string The server relative url of the file you want to copy
destinationUrl string The server relative url of the destination
[requestDigest] string <optional>
 The request digest token used to authorize the request. One will be automatically retrieved if not passed.
Source:
  • web.js, line 175
Example
var sourceFile = "/sites/mysite/Shared Documents/myfile.docx";
var destination = "/sites/mysite/Restricted Docs/myFile.docx";
dao.web.copyFile(sourceFile, destination).then(function() { console.log("Success") });

deleteFile(fileUrl, [requestDigest]opt)

Deletes a file
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
fileUrl string The server relative url of the file you want to delete
[requestDigest] string <optional>
 The request digest token used to authorize the request. One will be automatically retrieved if not passed.
Source:
  • web.js, line 197
Example
dao.web.deleteFile("/sites/mysite/Shared Documents/myFile.docx")
			.then(function() { console.log("Success")});

getFile(url) → {Promise.<File>}

Retrieves a file object
Parameters:
Name Type Description
url string The server relative url of the file
Source:
  • web.js, line 160
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves to a file object
Type
Promise.<File>
Example
dao.web.getFile("/sites/mysite/Shared Documents/myfile.docx")
			.then(function(file) { console.log(file) });

getFolder(serverRelativeUrl) → {Promise.<Folder>}

Retrieves a folder
Parameters:
Name Type Description
serverRelativeUrl string The server relative url of the folder
Source:
  • web.js, line 65
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves to a folder object contain a files and folders arrays
Type
Promise.<Folder>
Example
dao.web.getFolder("/sites/mysite/Shared Documents")
			.then(function(folder) { console.log(folder) });

getRequestDigest() → {string}

Retrieves a token needed to authorize any updates
Source:
  • web.js, line 52
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves to a the token that needs to added to the "X-RequestDigest" request header
Type
string
Example
dao.web.getRequestDigest().then(function(digest) { console.log(digest) });

getUser(email) → {Promise.<SP.User>}

Retrieves a users object based on an email address
Parameters:
Name Type Description
email string The email address of the user to retrieve
Source:
  • web.js, line 219
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves to a an SP.User object
Type
Promise.<SP.User>
Example
dao.web.getUser("andrew@andrewpetersen.onmicrosoft.com")
			.then(function(user) { console.log(user)});

info() → {Promise.<SP.Web>}

Retrieves basic information about the site
Source:
  • web.js, line 28
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves to an object containing non-deferred properties of SP.Web (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/office/jj244873.aspx)
Type
Promise.<SP.Web>
Example
dao.web.info().then(function(info) { console.log(info) });

subsites() → {Promise.<Array.<SP.Web>>}

Retrieves all of the subsites
Source:
  • web.js, line 40
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves to an array of subsite object, each loaded with all non-deferred properties
Type
Promise.<Array.<SP.Web>>
Example
dao.web.subsites().then(function(sites) { console.log(sites) });

uploadFile(fileContent, folderUrl, [fields]opt, [requestDigest]opt)

Uploads a file
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
fileContent HTML5.File | string Either an HTML5 File object (from a File input element) or the string content of the file
folderUrl string The server relative folder where the file should be uploaded
[fields] object <optional>
 An optional object containig the fields that should be set on the file after the upload completes. You can override the filename by passing 'name' property { name: "NewFileName.docx"}
[requestDigest] string <optional>
 The request digest token used to authorize the request. One will be automatically retrieved if not passed.
Source:
  • web.js, line 99
Example

Upload files with file input element, assumes 

var inputElement = document.getElementById("file-input");
inputElement.addEventListener("change", handleFiles, false);
function handleFiles() {
   var fileList = this.files;
   var folderUrl = "/spscript/Shared Documents";
   for (var i = 0; i < fileList.length; i++) {
       dao.web.uploadFile(fileList[i], folderUrl).then(function(result){
           console.log(result);
       });
   }
}
